title: Mia Chloe
author: Mia Chloe
content: Many a time, I've always insisted on the fact that most of the information we have online have a huge majority of them wrong with just a very few right. In simple terms we actually have more wrong information on the internet these days than the right ones. And the alarming thing about it is that the wrong ones are basically far more easier to access. This is the reason why many persons can't really vividly capture properly the details concerning the security of their coins.Long story short, I got a little bored while surfing on my mobile and I decided to hit up something quite interesting on Google, and below were the results;Now most newbies would rush into believing these without proper research. I see most of these results as ads basically come to think of it, a single open source wallet didn't pop up as part of the top 10 results. "it's not only about doing your own research, it's about doing your own research in details"

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: If it was a newbie that did that search, I bet that the person will definitely end up choosing any of those wallets. Seem that Google have a problem with providing a valid result for searches that is concerning Bitcoin wallets alone. I remember searching for "Bitcoin decentralized wallets" On google but the results I got was "atomic wallet, uniswap, and the rest was just some exchange that I am not even family with and the other results were " Top 10 crypto wallet". I was specific to search for "BTC decentralized wallet" But yet they there was no result like that. Like OP said, people need to be careful when doing research and they also need to verify their results with more than one source.

comments.author: Sticky Bomb
comments.body: People, especially newbies should be well informed that the standard things are not gotten easily, just like coinbase which is closed source being the first to pop out during your search, this is also because the company does a high level of SEO which places it at top spot of search and I doubt Electrum, Sparrow and Blue wallet providers have such time to initiate such marketing prospects for their open source wallets. The Internet has been seen as a dependent source of information, with people trusting the first search results as the most accurate, this leads most to mistakes. It's obvious this is one of the serious limitations of the Internet, with proper marketing, even lower quality products can find it's way to the top of responses during search

comments.body: I have posted about this before but it has been long. Google search engine do gives wrong and misleading information. It has been happening for years and it is still happening while Google do not mind. The search is also an easy means some people are gotten exposed to scammers.

I was specific to search for "BTC decentralized wallet" But yet they there was no result like that.Quote from: _act_ on February 26, 2025, 09:43:11 AMI have posted about this before but it has been long. Google search engine do gives wrong and misleading information. It has been happening for years and it is still happening while Google do not mind. The search is also an easy means some people are gotten exposed to scammers. You guys need to learn how search engines, especially Google, work. The results that we see aren't based on ratings by people or research done by specialists about the topic we are using for the search, but the results are based on SEO optimizations of those pages and websites. Have you ever heard about SEO backlinks and keywords and how websites use them to rank themselves higher in Google search results?So, it's all the game of doing SEO and getting your website and your web pages ranked high in search engine results, and that is how they generate traffic and possibly get more customers.It's true that someone who doesn't know how these searches work might think they are getting the best possible results about that thing, but that isn't always necessary because these results aren't based on best to worst, but they are based on strongest to weakest SEO optimizations.

What I have found about the use of AI for search queries is that unlike Google, the person can proble further and will eventually have the right information. And there are prompts that instructs AI to sift the incorrect information and to provide only the accurate and up to date information with the sources.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Most of crypto related press is not investigative, meaning that fake news can spread and circulate most of the news services without verifying their source, so what matters to them is clicks and advertisements, not credibility.The research procedure is in the knowledge and tracking of the issuance and the credibility of the platforms that publish news, and accordingly, the link between prices and news can be understood.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: They key of Bitcoin is "don't trust, verify", whatever we do, always remember with that idiom.Is Bitcoin real and how we can trust it? verify the source https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoinIs centralized exchange safe? they didn't give seed phrase, not safe.Is this wallet (Trust Wallet) safe? they give seed phrase, looks safe, can we verify the source? nope, not fully open source.Is this wallet (Electrum) safe? they give seed phrase, looks safe, can we verify the source? yes, indeed it's safe https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Oh, mine...If that is what surprises you, I've seen the worst online, there is too much misinformation one way or another, especially if you didn't search correctly. The best online could be made to look worse and the worst could be made to look like the best, it's a social media era where AI does it (good or bad) and paid adverts and SEO are pushing the information upwards even if they are the lowest relevant. I recommend more manual research than relying on automatic suggestions.

comments.author: Rustam Meraj
comments.body: Internet has a lot of wrong information making it hard to find correct and trustworthy information. It is worrying that wrong information is mostly easier to find than correct information. This is especially serious when it comes to important topics like keeping cryptocurrencies safe. What happened when you searched on Google is great example of this problem. Many people who are new to this might quickly believe results without doing thorough investigation. You are right to stress importance of carefully researching and checking information from many sources to make sure it is accurate.Basically we can't do anything regarding this. Means daily new and new websites are coming on internet which are almost look like real one and mostly newbies get trapped in these kind of websites. The only thing which a newbie can do is to be careful while searching or involving in any website.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: That is why we shouldn't rely on research AIs and Google answers when looking for legit and accurate informations. Google, for an example, just reproduces what a website says about its own services, as we can see regards Coinbase. AIs are also pretty inconsistent on this matter.And those automatic mechanisms aren't everything. There are also many malicious internet users who manipulate facts and create fake news to lure naive and greedy potential investors into mistakes.It's hard to know where to access legit informations nowadays online. At same time decentralization brought us benefits when sharing news, which were monopoly of few media channels previously, it also opens the possibility people manufacture events.
